title: Smart ticket
content:
Smart Analytics can intelligently populate fields defined in smart ticket tasks. To customize the smart ticket settings, log in to Agent Interface and navigate to Administration > Configuration > AI Studio > Smart Ticket.

Create a smart ticket task

To create a smart ticket task, follow these steps:

  1. Click New.

  2. In the dialog box that opens, specify the following fields:

    Field Description
    Module name

    Select Request from the drop-down list.
    Predicted field

    Select a predicted field from the drop-down list. The available values are Offering, Service, Category, and Assignment group.

    If you select Assignment group as the predicted field and want the system to automatically fill a value for the Assignment Group field in a smart ticket, you must tailor the corresponding form and business rules, see the Tailor form and business rules for Assignment Group prediction section.
    Training sample query (Optional) Specify a sample data query, through which you can decide what kind of data you want to use as sample data to teach Smart Analytics to build intelligence out of your large data volume. By default, the system uses all HR Request, Service Request, or Support Request data as training samples.

    For example, if you set a query as MATCH{Close}:PHASEID, the system only uses the closed requests as sample data. In this example, PHASEID is the IDOL field name and Close is one of its values.

    You can also add multiple conditions to one query, for example, if you set a query as MATCH{SupportRequest}:ESS-DOCUMENT-TYPE AND MATCH{Close}:PHASEID, the system only uses the closed support requests as sample data. For more information about how to write a query, see FieldText in IDOL documentation.
    Predicted field query

    (Optional) Specify a query, through which you can decide what kind of value that Smart Analytics learns for Predicted field. For example, if you select Offering in Predicted field, you can use this query to define which offering items will be learned by training the sample data. The system automatically fills the offering items for a new request according to its issue description. The syntax of this query is the same as the training sample query. For example:

    If you set this query to NOTMATCH{Inactive}:STATUS, the system will only learn from the active offerings.

    If you set this query to MATCH{12419, 12295}:ENTITYID, the system will only learn from offerings of ID 12419 and 12295.

    If you set this query to MATCH{SupportOffering}:ESS-DOCUMENT-TYPE AND NOTMATCH{Inactive}:STATUS, the system will only learn from those active support offerings.
    Content fields This field is automatically filled with the value description.
    Entitlement fields

    Specify the fields, through which Smart Analytics can automatically fill the predicted field according to the requestor's permission definitions.

    In this release, the system automatically defines the entitlement fields according to the Predicted field settings.
  3. Click Save.

Edit a smart ticket task

To edit a smart ticket configuration task, follow these steps:

  1. Click the task name, and then review the general information of the task.
    The Active field indicates whether a trained model is available for the auto-assignment of a task. After the training is complete, the field will be selected, indicating its readiness for auto-assignment.

  2. Click the Configurations tab to update the settings.

    You can modify the following settings to optimize the accuracy of auto-suggestion. These settings are tradeoffs between training time and accuracy, which means higher accuracy is achieved at the cost of longer training time. This table provides some best practices for these optimization configurations. 

    Setting Description
    Training samples per predicted field

    The maximum number of records to be used as the training samples for each value of Predicted field.

    Default: 200
    Test data coverage

    The percentage of records out of the total source data that are used to test the trained system.

    Default: 5
    Source data coverage

    The percentage of records out of the total source data that a predicted value can cover. The system will analyze the distribution of the existing records, arrange predicted value by request amount in descending order, and then calculate accumulations. The smart ticket will automatically fill Predicted field value from the top till the accumulation reaches the defined Source data coverage value.

    A higher percentage means higher accuracy, but there is a threshold point. When the training source data percentage exceeds the threshold, the margin contribution will be lowered remarkably. The out-of-the-box value for this configuration is 90%, which is the best number tested in the lab.

    Default: 90
    Prediction threshold
    The minimum confidence percentage a model must achieve to return a valid prediction for the target field.
    Default: 30%
  3. To verify if your query is correct, click Test training query for Training sample query, and Test predict query for Predicted field query.
  4. Click Save to save your changes.

Perform training and testing

To perform training for a smart ticket task, follow these steps:

  1. Select the check box before a smart ticket task, or click the smart ticket task name.
  2. Click Train to start training this auto-classification.
  3. Click Refresh to view the latest training status. When the training is done, click Test.
  4. When the testing is finished, check the status in the smart ticket task list. Or, click the smart ticket task name to view an estimated accuracy result for this auto-classification in the Testing result field. For example: 
    First hit count: 7; correct rate: 50.00%
Second hit count: 0; correct rate: 50.00%
Third hit count: 1; correct rate: 57.14%
Missed count: 6; missed rate: 42.86%
"***************** Total samples: 14 ******************

Remove a smart ticket task

To remove a smart ticket task, select the check box before the smart ticket task and then click Delete.

Tailor form and business rules for Assignment Group prediction

If you choose Assignment Group as the predicted field and want the system to automatically populate the Assignment Group field in a smart ticket, you must customize the corresponding form and business rules by following these steps:

  1. In Agent Interface, select Administration > Configuration > Studio.
  2. Select Request from the record type drop-down list, and then click the Forms tab to access the form editor.
  3. Select the withoutResolution form from the drop-down list, and then click Add field. The system opens the Select fields dialog box.
  4. Select Assignment group, and then click ADD. Close the Select fields dialog box, and then click Save.
  5. Click the Processes and Rules tab and expand the After change rule.
  6. Scroll down to locate the Resets Assignment group and Assignee when Current assignment field is set to Incident or to Unassigned rule. Click the AssignedToGroup:${null} link, click Remove in the pop-up window, and then click Save.
  7. Locate the If current assignment is set to Expert group, set Assignment group and Assignee as the Expert group and Expert assignee rule, and then remove the AssignedToGroup: ${entity.ExpertGroup} expression.
  8. Locate the If Current assignment is set to Service desk, set Assignment group and Assignee as the Service desk group and Service desk assignee rule, and then update the rule as follows: 
    If ${entity.CurrentAssignment == 'ServiceDesk'}
Set AssignedToPerson: ${entity.OwnedByPerson}
  9. Click Add, select "If...Then" rule, select Set field, and then click OK to add a new rule. Update the rule as follows: 
    If ${entity.CurrentAssignment == 'ExpertGroup' && entity.AssignedToGroup == null}
Set Assignment group to ${entity.ExpertGroup}
  10. Click Add, select "If...Then" rule, select Set field, and then click OK to add a new rule. Update the rule as follows: 
    If ${entity.CurrentAssignment == 'ServiceDesk' && entity.AssignedToGroup == null}
Set Assignment group to ${entity.ServiceDeskGroup}
  11. Click Save to save your changes.
